text:
I hit this upon reading http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-c14n#Example-Chars

The context:

NMTOKEN attribute values should be normalized by collapsing
whitespace as follows:

<!DOCTYPE doc [
<!ATTLIST normNames attr NMTOKENS #IMPLIED>
]>
<doc>
   <norm attr=' '    
	   ' '/>
   <normNames attr='   A    
	   B   '/>
</doc>

is equivalent to:

<doc>
   <norm attr=" '    
	   ' "></norm>
   <normNames attr="A 
	 B"></normNames>
</doc>  

The CR, LF, and TAB characters given as character references
to NMTOKENS should not be collapsed!

My fix proposal:

Attribute's value is already normalized during parseLitteral()
by replacing TABs, CRs and LFs to spaces.  The call to normalize
at line 1415 of Parser2.java should only collapse spaces (' ') not
XMLWhitespaces (TABs, LF, CR which are there because of character
references).

normalize is called in 4 places: at lines 1415 as well as 2214, 2236
It normalizes attribute values parsed using parseLiteral and should
actually be changed to normalizeSpaces.  The fourth call is at
parsePublicId (line 872) and maybe that's correct.

By the way: the xerces 1.4.2 has the same problem but 2.0.0 Beta 2
has corrected it.

Ancient bug report against Crimson. Not an XML Commons issue.

Note that Crimson which has had no activity in years will likely soon be retired to the Apache Attic. It's unlikely that any problems reported against it will ever be fixed.
